metadata.description: The name of virtual machine to deploy.
The tags to be applied to the deployed resources.
The location in which the virtual machine will be deployed.
The custom data in form of 'key=value' to be passed to the virtual machine. Should be delimited with a pipe (vertical bar).
The value used to generate a computer name for the AD. This defaults to the value of the parameter 'name' if no value is provided.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine.
The list of data disk sizes in GB which are used to add data disks to virtual machine.
The full resource ID of subnet where the virtual machine will be created in.
The name of the keyvault which stores secure values for the virtual machine.
The full resource ID of the managed image resource that will be used to create virtual machine.
The username of the local admin account for the virtual machine.
The public key that will allow SSH admin access to the virtual machine.
The domain of the Active Directory where the virtual machine will join to enforce VM access controls.
The username of the AD user that will be used to join the virtual machine to the Active Directory.
The password of the AD user that will be used to join the virtual machine to the Active Directory.
The name of the AD user group in the Active Directory that should have administrative permissions on the virtual machine.
The distinguished name of Active Directory organizational unit for the virtual machine.
The distinguished group name of the Active Directory entity that will be granted access to login to the virtual machine.
The SAS tokenized URL to be used for the SOC Event Hub integration.
The name of the storage account to which diagnostic data will be transferred.
The SAS token of the diagnostic storage account.
The flag which indicates whether IP forwarding is enabled on the network interface of the virtual machine.
The flag which indicates whether the network interface of the virtual machine is accelerated networking enabled.
The full resource ID of the associated user assigned managed identity. NOTES: This feature is in Private Preview!
The secret of the service principal to grant access to the key vault. NOTES: This parameter will be deprecated when the Managed Service Identity feature is GA!
The object ID of the service prinicapl to grant access to the key vault. NOTES: This parameter will be deprecated when the Managed Service Identity feature is GA!
The application ID of the service principal to grant access to the key vault. NOTES: This parameter will be deprecated when the Managed Service Identity feature is GA!

protectedSettings.commandToExecute: [concat('sh /opt/daa/bootstrap/bootstrap.sh --ad-user ', parameters('adJoinUsername'), ' --ad-password ''', parameters('adJoinPassword'), ''' --ad-fqdn ', parameters('adDomain'), ' --ad-admin-group ', parameters('adAdminGroup'), ' --group-dn ', parameters('adGroupDn'), ' --allowed-dn ', parameters('adAllowedDn'))]
